description: Ryan Galvin's late equaliser earns Halifax a 1-1 draw at Eastleigh to aid their bid for a promotion play-off spot.
title: Eastleigh 1-1 Halifax Town
maintext:
Ryan Galvin's late equaliser earned Halifax a 1-1 draw at Eastleigh to aid their bid for a promotion play-off spot.
The hosts had the chance to go in front after 30 minutes when Jake Taylor was brought down in the area. The midfielder took the resulting penalty himself but it was palmed away by keeper Toby Savin before Tyrese Shade put the rebound wide.
Eastleigh's bad luck continued as both Noa Boutin and Nathan Tshikuna struck the crossbar, while Ben Close had a goal disallowed after 57 minutes for a foul during the build-up.
Things finally seemed to turn in the Spitfires' favour on the hour mark when they were awarded another spot-kick, this time for a challenge on Luis Fernandez, with Chris Maguire slotting into the bottom corner.
However, that brought Halifax to life and they snatched an unlikely equaliser a minute before time when Galvin successfully met Jack Jenkins' corner with his head.
